document_data.name: ''Gauntlets of Ogre Power''
document_data.mainbody: '''''Gauntlets of ogre power''''' were a number of sets of [[:Category:Wondrous items|wondrous]] gauntlets that would grant the wielder the strength of an [[ogre]]. It was required that both individual glove be worn for the [[item enchantment|enchantment]] to take effect, and they would not benefit anyone who already possessed more strength. A number of sets of these gauntlets have appeared throughout [[Faerûn]] over the span of thousands of years.
document_data.Known Sets:
One set of the gauntlets, known as the ''[[Hands of Takkok]]'', were precisely that: the severed hands of the [[ogre]] Takkok, which were removed from his body by a powerful mage he had assaulted in the [[Spine of the World]]. They were then fashioned into the set of enchanted, ogre-skin gloves. Some time later they came into the possession of the entropy-worshiping [[rogue]] [[Desreta]], who was known to frequent the [[Low Lantern]] tavern in [[Baldur's Gate]].

A stash of ''gauntlets of ogre power'' was uncovered within a great cache of treasure in the nation of [[Calimshan]] sometime around the year [[1372 DR]].

When the former [[Riders of Nesmé|Rider of Nesmé]] [[Rannek]], along with his allies [[Zhai]] and [[Illius]], explored the [[Gemspark Mine]] in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]], he discovered and donned a set of the gauntlets. He was known for using his newfound strength to outright destroy walls or other impeding obstacles he encountered in his journeys.

In the 15{{th}} century [[DR]], a set of ''gauntlets of ogre power'' could be found in [[Wave Echo Cave]] near [[Phandalin]].
document_data.Creation:
While the gloves could be made from ordinary leather or ogre skin

document_data.Variants:
''Gauntlets of ogre power'' would cap the user's strength at that of an ogre. There were, however, other sets of gauntlets which increased the user's strength even further. Such gauntlets were known as ''gauntlets of giant strength'', which themselves scaled to the power of the specific giant. For example, a pair of gauntlets modifying the user's strength to that of a [[stone giant]] could be found in the [[Temple of Dumathoin]].

''Lesser gauntlets of ogre power'' were significantly less powerful variants of these items. The wearer received only a slight boost to their strength instead of having their strength equal to that of an ogre.
